answers.answer: 47% is not that bad.  Normal is considered 55-70   (some will say 50-70).  Have you been put on meds?  Told to watch sodium?  The single most important thing you can do is get your sodium down under 2000mg per day.  If you read labels you will see that processed food is pretty high.  You can get a day's worth of sodium in one can of soup.I had 10-13% EF at diagnosis....today it is over 50%....Just do what the docs say and I would think you will be fine.

Thanks. I hope so, b/c worry is eating me alive. I am so worried that I will need a transplant or pass away, and I'm 19.. Just gave birth to a beautiful baby girl. I have been keeping my sodium very low, I try to get below 1,000 mg a day just to be safe. I wasn't eating much at all b/c of fear. But I've been researching on what is safe to eat, and I have been changing my diet to a more healthy one. I have not retained any water.. And I've been keeping my BP under control with my meds, Lisenoprol and Lopresser. I'm just afraid that i will suddenly develop CHF again. I know that I am still considered to have it, but I'm afraid that instead of improving, that I will slip back to where I was before.. It's very scary for me. Thanks for your help. And I'm glad to hear you are back over 50% again. take care.. hope to tty soon

Yo could look at the issue from the point of view that now you will follow a healthier diet and this is how you daughter will learn to eat.  If you are in a temperate climate taking her for walks in her stroller will help you too.  Fresh air for little pistonette and you strenghthen your body, how cool is that that what helps you benefits her!

50% is considered recovered.  I was 49% at diagnosis, now at 65%.  Even people with numbers at 15% at diagnosis have recovered, the heart is truly amazing.  Please come visit us at A Mother's Heart :)  We've got a boatload of information that you'll find very comforting and reassuring.

sometimes when I breathe really hard I have a little soreness around my heart. My symptoms seem to be getting better, besides that. I'm not retaining water &  my meds are keeping my blood pressure lower than normal. Docs say that my blood pressure being a little low will give my heart a chance to repair itself. But, the sorness is not a pain or doesnt feel like its stabbing me. It's just a little sore when I take a super-deep breath. Could this be a sign I'm retaining water in my lungs again, or could it be associated with my recent CHF? Everything else seems to be recovering well.

pistons, try weighing yourself each morning just after you wake and evacuate your system.  Keep your weight in mind and worry only if you gain a pretty good amount in a few days span.  This could be a sign of fluid buildup.  My EF is in mid thirties and I feel perfectly well.  Don't know about the deep breath problem though.
As FLBrat noted, with fluid comes weight.  Any time you have 3+ pounds overnight, call a doctor immediately.  Some PPCMers have have chest pains well after recovery for reasons not well understood.

question: I posted a message earlier this week. I was recently diagnosed with CHF due to preeclampsia in a recent pregnancy. I was not sure what my E.F. was until my cousin looked up my medical records online today, she works at a doctors office. She said that on my last echo my E.F. was 47%. That made me feel a little better, b/c although its low, there is a chance of recovery. Is 47% still a pretty bad number? I am so willing to do whatever it takes to get my healthy heart and normal life back.
title: E.F. of 47%.. what do you guys think?
